title: About
text:
I am a multidisciplinary researcher specializing in data science, economics and public policy. I currently work as a data analyst for the Penn Wharton Budget Model (PWBM) at the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. At PWBM, I contribute to the organization’s work on simulating the impacts of various policy measures on the United States (U.S.) economy through microsimulation models. In particular, my work focuses on the applications of machine learning in economic modelling and policy research.
Prior to this, I completed a master’s degree in Data Analytics and Public Policy from Carnegie Mellon University, a master’s in economics from the Delhi School of Economics and a bachelor’s degree in economics from the University of Delhi.
